prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Shape Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with a rotation of 0.0 degrees along the x-axis, 0.0 degrees along the y-axis, and -90.0 degrees along the z-axis. Translate it by 0.0 along x, 0.3188 along y, and 0.0 along z. Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch on the Plane Defined by the Coordinate System Create the first face of the sketch as follows: Curve 1: Draw a line from 0.0, 0.0 to 0.0281, 0.0 (on the x-axis) Curve 2: Draw a line from 0.0281, 0.0 to 0.0281, 0.7125 (on the y-axis) Curve 3: Draw an arc from 0.0281, 0.7125 with a radial endpoint at 0.0309, 0.7191, and a tangent endpoint at 0.0375, 0.7219 Curve 4: Draw a line from 0.0375, 0.7219 to 0.2812, 0.7219 (on the x-axis) Curve 5: Draw a line from 0.2812, 0.7219 to 0.2812, 0.75 (on the y-axis) Curve 6: Draw a line from 0.2812, 0.75 to 0.0375, 0.75 (on the x-axis) Curve 7: Draw an arc from 0.0375, 0.75 with a radial endpoint at 0.011, 0.739, and a tangent endpoint at 0.0, 0.7125 Curve 8: Draw a line from 0.0, 0.7125 to 0.0, 0.0 (taking it back to the starting point) The sketch must be closed. This sketch contains two lines and two arcs. Step 3: Convert 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided earlier in the coordinate system step. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch into a 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis, 0.1594 units in the normal direction and an additional 0.1594 units in the opposite direction of the normal. This operation results in a new solid body. Final Details The dimensions of this rectangular prismic part are as follows: - length: 0.75 - width: 0.3187 - height: 0.75 (including the extrusion's height)</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.3188,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.0281,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0281,0.0],"End Point":[0.0281,0.7125]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.0281,0.7125],"Mid Point":[0.0309,0.7191],"End Point":[0.0375,0.7219]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.7219],"End Point":[0.2812,0.7219]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.2812,0.7219],"End Point":[0.2812,0.75]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2812,0.75],"End Point":[0.0375,0.75]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.75],"Mid Point":[0.011,0.739],"End Point":[0.0,0.7125]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.7125],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1594,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.1594,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Next, draw the 2D sketch on the XY plane containing a single face with four lines: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.5, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the 2D sketch using the 'sketch_scale' parameter: * sketch_scale: 0.75 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector, followed by extruding the sketch to generate the 3D model: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.3 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 * operation: Create new solid body Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.3] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane containing a single face with four lines: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.15, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.15, 0.0] to [0.15, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.15, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the 2D sketch: * sketch_scale: 0.75 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D, followed by extruding the sketch to generate the 3D model: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.15 * operation: Cut material Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.225, 0.275, 0.3] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane containing a single face with a center and radius: * Center: [0.1, 0.1] * Radius: 0.1 Now, scale the 2D sketch: * sketch_scale: 0.2 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D, followed by extruding the sketch to generate the 3D model: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 1.25 * operation: Cut material This set of instructions will yield a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.3,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.15,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.225,0.275,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1,0.1],"Radius":0.1}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":1.25,"sketch_scale":0.2,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Create the Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in the previous step. Step 3: Draw the Outline of the Rectangular Prism On the sketch, draw a rectangle using two lines: - Line 1: From [0.0, 0.0313] to [0.7188, 0.0] - Line 2: From [0.7188, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.3438] - Line 3: From [0.75, 0.3438] to [0.0313, 0.375] - Line 4: From [0.0313, 0.375] to [0.0, 0.0313] Step 4: Draw the Outline of the Cylindrical Hole On the same sketch, draw the outline of the cylindrical hole using four arcs and four lines: - Arc 1: Center at [0.025, 0.1813], radius 0.125, from [0.125, 0.1813] to [0.1563, 0.15] - Line 5: From [0.1563, 0.15] to [0.5938, 0.15] - Arc 2: Center at [0.6063, 0.1813], radius 0.125, from [0.5938, 0.15] to [0.625, 0.1813] - Line 6: From [0.625, 0.1813] to [0.625, 0.225] - Arc 3: Center at [0.6063, 0.2587], radius 0.125, from [0.625, 0.225] to [0.5938, 0.2587] - Line 7: From [0.5938, 0.2587] to [0.1563, 0.2587] - Arc 4: Center at [0.1338, 0.2587], radius 0.125, from [0.1563, 0.2587] to [0.125, 0.225] - Line 8: From [0.125, 0.225] to [0.125, 0.1813] Step 5: Add Constraints Add constraints to the sketch to make it closed and ensure the loops are properly connected: - Close the rectangle loop - Close the cylindrical hole loop Step 6: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.05 units. This creates the first part of the final shape, a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole. Step 7: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch by 0.75 units to match the dimensions provided in the description. Part 1 Complete The final dimensions of this part should be: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.05 units Continue the same process for the subsequent parts, using the information provided in the JSON. Make sure to follow the instructions for each part, including the shape being constructed, detailed step-by-step instructions, and organizing each part's instructions with clear headings and section breaks.</description>

<description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners** **Step 1: Create Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the part. The euler angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Step 2: Create Sketch** Create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face (face\\_1) which is a rectangle with the following vertices (given as [x, y] coordinates): - Vertex 1: [0.0, 0.0] - Vertex 2: [0.4444, 0.0] - Vertex 3: [0.4444, 0.75] - Vertex 4: [0.0, 0.75] This face consists of four lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4). The lines form a closed loop (loop\\_1): - Line 1: Start from [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.4444, 0.0] - Line 2: Start from [0.4444, 0.0] and ends at [0.4444, 0.75] - Line 3: Start from [0.4444, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start from [0.0, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Transform Sketch to 3D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch according to the scaling factor sketch\\_scale (0.75) in the part parameters, and then apply the transformation on the 2D sketch using the euler angles Euler Angles ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and translation vector Translation Vector ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) from the coordinate system. This results in a 3D sketch. **Step 4: Extrude Sketch to Generate 3D Model** Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal with an extrusion depth of 0.5 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite to the normal. The resulting shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. The length is 0.75 units, width is also 0.75 units and the height is 0.5 units.</description>

</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions 1.1 Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 1.2 Draw the Sketch for Face 1 Now create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system you just created. 1.2.1 Loop 1 - Polylines and Arc * Line 1: Start Point [0.1052, 0.0], End Point [0.3751, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.3751, 0.0], End Point [0.3751, 0.1052] * Line 3: Start Point [0.3751, 0.1052], End Point [0.3751, 0.2105] * Line 4: Start Point [0.3751, 0.2105], End Point [0.1052, 0.2105] * Arc 1: Start Point [0.1052, 0.2105], Mid Point [0.0, 0.1052], End Point [0.1052, 0.0] 1.2.2 Loop 2 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.0526, 0.1052], Radius 0.0132 1.2.3 Loop 3 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.1052, 0.1052], Radius 0.0329 1.2.4 Loop 4 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.1052, 0.0526], Radius 0.0132 1.2.5 Loop 5 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.1052, 0.1579], Radius 0.0132 1.2.6 Loop 6 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.1579, 0.1052], Radius 0.0132 1.3 Draw the Sketch for Face 2 Create another sketch on the X-Y plane of the same coordinate system. 1.3.1 Loop 1 - Polylines and Arc * Line 1: Start Point [0.3751, 0.0], End Point [0.3751, 0.1052] * Line 2: Start Point [0.3751, 0.1052], End Point [0.3751, 0.2105] * Line 3: Start Point [0.3751, 0.2105], End Point [0.6448, 0.2105] * Arc 1: Start Point [0.6448, 0.2105], Mid Point [0.75, 0.1052], End Point [0.6448, 0.0] * Line 4: Start Point [0.6448, 0.0], End Point [0.3751, 0.0] 1.3.2 Loop 2 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.5922, 0.1052], Radius 0.0132 1.3.3 Loop 3 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.6448, 0.1052], Radius 0.0329 1.3.4 Loop 4 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.6449, 0.0526], Radius 0.0132 1.3.5 Loop 5 - Circle * Circle 1: Center [0.6449, 0.1579], Radius 0.0132 1.3</description>
